author: Agatha Christie
quote: The impossible could not have happened, therefore the impossible must be possible in spite of appearances.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: I do not argue with the foolish. I simply do not deal with them.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: It is the impossible that must be examined, not the probable.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: The truth is, you are not allowed to be as good as you want to be. You are restricted by other people’s expectations.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: The instinct to tell the truth, when it is inconvenient, is a human characteristic.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: I am not a detective, but I know enough to tell when something is wrong.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: When you eliminate the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: A detective sees the world with different eyes. I see the things that others overlook.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: Everyone lies, but the truth can never be hidden.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: The smallest details are often the most important in solving a mystery.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: The mind is like a secret door: we never know what is behind it until we open it.

author: Agatha Christie

author: Agatha Christie
quote: It is not always easy to see the truth when you are standing in the middle of the mystery.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: The greatest deception is often the one we make ourselves believe.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: Everything is not what it seems. The truth is often hidden beneath layers of lies.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: The world is full of secrets. Some we never discover, and some we wish we hadn't.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: A clever person solves a problem, a wise person avoids it.

quote: There is no such thing as an accident, only fate.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: Murder is always a most personal crime. It is a question of control.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: The greatest mysteries are the ones we create ourselves.

author: Agatha Christie

author: Agatha Christie
quote: Every little detail must be taken into account. No clue is ever too small to be overlooked.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: In every crime, there is a motive, and in every motive, there is a secret.

author: Agatha Christie

author: Agatha Christie
quote: There are no innocent people, just those who have not yet been caught.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: The greatest evil is often committed by those who believe they are doing good.

author: Agatha Christie

author: Agatha Christie

author: Agatha Christie

author: Agatha Christie
quote: The best way to hide the truth is to make it so complicated that no one will ever figure it out.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: All crimes leave clues, but it is the good detective who can make sense of them.

quote: The truth is always the simplest solution, even if it's not the one we want to believe.

author: Agatha Christie

author: Agatha Christie
quote: The greatest mystery is not the crime itself, but the criminal’s motive.
